Sign in to the Azure Portal
resource group and click on the create button
Name: rg-ohg365-dev ‚Üí This is your Resource Group‚Äôs name.
Usually, names include clues about the project or environment:
dev = Environment (like dev, test, or prod)
Create: Add new Azure resources (like VMs, storage, databases).
Manage view: Customize how your resources list looks.
Delete resource group: Deletes the entire group and all its resources (be careful!).
Refresh: Updates the view if new resources were added.
Export to CSV: Export your resource details (helpful for reports).
Open query: Create or run custom filters using Azure Resource Graph.
Azure Blob Storage is Microsoft‚Äôs cloud-based service designed to store large amounts of data of various types ‚Äî including structured, semi-structured, and unstructured data.
It is ideal for storing files such as CSV, text, Excel, JSON, Parquet, Avro, XML, images, videos, backups, and logs.

The term ‚ÄúBlob‚Äù stands for Binary Large Object, meaning it can store any type of binary data. Blob Storage provides a flat namespace, meaning all files (blobs) are stored in containers within a storage account, rather than in a traditional hierarchical folder system.
Azure Blob Storage is highly scalable, secure, and cost-efficient, making it suitable for:
Storing and serving large files (media, documents, etc.)
In the search bar, type ‚ÄúStorage Accounts‚Äù
Click on storage accounts and click on create button
This is where you choose which Azure Subscription will own this storage account.
A subscription is linked to your billing and access control.
Example: You might have separate subscriptions for development, testing, or production environments.
Choose or create a Resource Group to organize related Azure resources.
Resource Groups act like folders ‚Äî all your related resources (VMs, storage, databases) are stored here for easy management.
In your case, you selected rg-ohg365-dev, which is perfect for development resources.
Tip: Keeping related resources in the same group helps you track cost, permissions, and manage everything easily.
This is the unique name for your storage account (like a domain name).
It must be globally unique, lowercase, and 3‚Äì24 characters long.
This name will form part of the URL to access your data.
Select what kind of storage service you want to enable.
The default (and most common) option is:
Azure Blob Storage or Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2
This means your account will support:
Data Lake capabilities (for analytics and big data processing)
Tip: Keep this as default unless you have a specific need for file shares or queue services.
Standard: Uses HDD-based storage ‚Äî cheaper, good for general use.
Premium: Uses SSD-based storage ‚Äî faster, ideal for workloads needing low latency (like databases or VMs).
Defines how Azure will replicate your data to keep it safe.
Copies across 3 availability zones in the same region
Copies data to another region (for disaster recovery)
Same as GRS but allows read access to secondary region

tab of your resource group, you‚Äôll see a list of all resources.

Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2 (ADLS Gen2)
Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2 is a highly scalable and secure
cloud storage service optimized for big data analytics
and data lakes. It builds on Azure Blob Storage capabilities but adds
file system semantics, hierarchical namespaces, and enhanced performance
ADLS Gen2 is designed to store massive volumes of
, making it ideal for big data and machine learning scenarios.
Unlike traditional Blob Storage, ADLS Gen2 supports folders and directories, enabling efficient organization and faster file operations at scale.
Supports Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS) and integrates seamlessly with analytics frameworks like Azure Databricks, HDInsight, and Azure Synapse Analytics.
You can store CSV, JSON, Parquet, Avro, ORC, images, videos, logs, backups, and more.
Provides enterprise-grade security with Azure Active Directory integration, role-based access control (RBAC), and encryption at rest and in transit.
Automatically scales to handle petabytes of data and millions of files with optimized storage tiers and pricing options.
for big data analytics and machine learning.
Integrating with analytics tools to perform complex queries and transformations.
Archiving and long-term data retention with tiered storage options.
